Policy: Cooperative Association Act ([RSBC 1996] Chapter 28).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for any 5 or more persons to form an association under this Act to carry on any lawful industry, trade or business on a cooperative basis. An association formed under this Act must include in its name the word " cooperative". The Act is divided into two parts, the first being; Establishment and Operation. Part 2 details, Housing Cooperatives. Sections 2-11 deal with the setting up of a cooperative ealing with capital, memorandum and rules, directors, registration of documents, and Conclusiveness of certificate. The rest of Part 1 deals with the operational mechanics of a cooperative, such as: section 12 Power and capacity, section 13 Extraordinary resolution, section 15 Redemption and reissue of shares; section 23 Contracts; section 25 Membership; section 31 Directors; section 33 Meetings; section 35 Arbitration of disputes; section 40 Annual report; section 47 Confidentiality; section 51 Immunity; section 54 Court proceedings on member's complaint; section 63 Dissolution and winding up; section 73 Fees; section 78 Power to make regulations; and section 79 Offence and penalty. In Part 2 "housing cooperative" means an association providing accommodation for persons the majority of whom are members of the association and are ordinarily resident in the accommodation. It details, section 83, the right of a member of a cooperative to have their possession terminated; or section 84 possession by way of a Court.

Policy: Measures on the Administration of Pollution Sources Monitoring.
Policy_Content: These Measures provide for the monitoring of pollution sources i.e. monitoring of pollution discharge, monitoring of sites of production, storage, disposal, utilization and discharge of solid wastes, etc. Environmental protection bureaus at all levels shall organize supervisory monitoring of the pollution sources and assume responsibilities specified in Chapter II and be responsible for the establishment of local pollution sources monitoring networks and guide local monitoring work (Chapter III). Environmental protection bureaus in charge of pollution discharging units shall demand for environmental management, categories of pollutants discharged, state pollutants discharge standards, regulate the monitoring of pollutants outlets and pollution treatment facilities, etc. (Chapter IV and V). Environmental monitoring stations shall regularly report the results of monitoring and the registered pollution discharge data to the environmental protection bureau.

Policy: Meteorology Law of the People's Republic of China.
Policy_Content: This Law aims at developing meteorological service, standardizing meteorological activities, ensuring the accurate and timely issue of meteorological forecast, preventing meteorological disasters, properly exploiting and effectively protecting climatic resources.  Competent meteorological departments at all levels shall arrange for climatic feasibility studies relating to city planning, key national construction projects, major regional economic development projects and large projects for the exploitation of climatic resources such as solar and wind energy (art.34). Moreover, the Law regulates meteorological observation, forecasting, services, prevention of meteorological disasters, exploitation of climatic resources and research in meteorological science and technology. Meteorological activities that organizations and individuals of other countries wish to conduct in China shall be subject to approval by the competent meteorological department under the State Council in conjunction with relevant departments(art. 8). The Law further provides for offences and penalties.

Policy: Water Laws of the Tuzla Canton.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates management and conservation of water for the purpose of use of water, protecting water from pollution, management water basins, and protection from flood and erosion and other negative impact of water. Within this framework it also provides for tasks, functions, powers or rights of bodies of the Tuzla Canton, municipalities, and other legal entities and citizens. The Act shall apply to surface waters, water springs, natural lakes, and water in artificial accumulations, retentions and lakes, underground waters and thermal and mineral waters. Territorial units for water management are water areas and basin areas. Article 9 and following provide for the water-economy basis, a basic instrument of water resources management and conservation planning. Articles 17 to 29 concern other matters of public administration and the management of various water-economy structures for drainage and irrigation, sewerage, fish farms, water protection, and various types of supply of water. Article 30 prohibits various activities on waters and shores. Article 32 and following provide for the issuing or granting of “water economy acts” i.e. water-economy conditions, water-economy agreements, water-economy licences or water-economy orders. Other provisions concern water economy agreements, drinking water, protection form water pollution (art. 57 and following), the Cantonal Council for Waters, the Directorate of Waters (art. 61), financing of water management and conservation, supervision over implementation of provisions of the Law, limitations to the rights of owners, or users of the land, construction, use, protection, maintenance, management of water-supply structures in rural settlements, water conservation zones and miscellaneous matters. (112 articles divided into 13 Parts)

Policy: Legislative Decree No. 454 rearranging the agricultural research sector as per article 11 of Act No. 59 of 15 March 1997.
Policy_Content: The Legislative Decree establishes the Agricultural Research and Experimentation Council, which shall be subject to the supervision of the Ministry of Agricultural and Forestry Policies. The Council must draw up a three-year plan for determining the objectives, priorities as well as human and financial resources necessary for carrying out its own activities. The plan shall be elaborated by taking into account the European Union research programmes. The plan shall thereafter be approved by the Ministry of Agricultural and Forestry Policies. The Council is in charge of the performance and promotion of scientific researches, elaboration of projects intended for developing less favoured agricultural lands and water systems. Furthermore, the Council shall boost the modernization of agricultural techniques and perform checks on biotechnologies. It shall act by collaborating with Universities, institutes and laboratories of the National Research Council (C.N.R.). Article 6 lays down measures in matter of financial resources.

Policy: Environmental Quality (Refrigerant Management) Regulations 1999 (No. 451)
Policy_Content: These Regulations have been adopted on the basis of section 51 of the Environmental Quality Act 1974 (No. 127). The provisions shall apply to a person handling a refrigerant environmentally hazardous substance in an existing or a new installation. Regulation 4 prohibits the use of refrigerant environmentally hazardous substances as refrigerants in any new installation of a building chiller or refrigeration system. Moreover, no person shall vent any refrigerant environmentally hazardous substance into the atmosphere, except with the prior written approval of the Director General. Regulation 7 concerns the prohibition on moving refrigerant environmentally hazardous substances out of Malaysia. The Schedule attached specifies the substances which shall be covered by these Regulations.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Environmental Quality (Halon Management) Regulations 1999, PU (A) 452.
Policy_Content: Since halon is a substance that depletes the ozone layer, these Regulations prohibit its use, particularly in fire protection systems. In accordance with regulation 4, the use of any new portable halon fire extinguisher is prohibited. Regulation 5 prescribes that an owner or a person in control of halon shall inform the Director General of any halon in his possession. Regulation 12 establishes that an owner or a person in control of an existing halon fire extinguishing system shall ensure that halon is not discharged in any test or under any other circumstances unless the purpose is to prevent fire. Two schedules are attached. The second one lays down essential use criteria for the use of any portable halon fire extinguisher or fixed halon fire extinguishing system.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: The Regulations entered into force on 1 January 2000.

Policy: Loi sur les gravières et exploitations assimilées.
Policy_Content: La présente loi s'applique aux exploitations à ciel ouvert de gravier, sable et argile. La présente loi a pour but: a) de planifier l'extraction des matériaux nécessaires aux constructions et aménagements publics et privés en vue d'une utilisation rationnelle du territoire et des ressources naturelles; b) de garantir un approvisionnement du canton en gravier, sable et argile indigènes en quantité et diversité suffisantes, compatible avec le principe du développement durable;  c) de veiller à un remblayage des gravières par des matériaux inertes dans le respect des dispositions de la législation fédérale et de la législation cantonale en matière de gestion des déchets. Le texte comprend 42 articles répartis en 8 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (I); Planification (II); Exploitation (III); Remise en état des lieux (IV); Mesures administratives (V); Sanctions administratives (VI);Voies de recours (VII); Dispositions finales (VIII).

Policy: Law on patents.
Policy_Content: This Law governs the economic and non-economic aspects of the creation, legal protection and use of inventions, utility models and industrial designs. An invention shall be industrially applicable if it can be made or used in industry, agriculture, public health or other fields. Neither plant varieties nor animal breeds shall constitute patentable inventions. Strains of microorganisms, plants or animal cells, or their use for a new purpose, may not be protected as utility models. The Law establishes terms and conditions for the issuance of patents.

Policy: Regulation on protection zone of Central Forest state natural biosphere reserve.
Policy_Content: Regulation on protection zone of Central Forest state natural biosphere reserve establishes that land pertaining to protection zone shall not be expropriated from owners, tenants and possessors. Land tenants on the territory of protection zone shall be agricultural cooperatives, collective farms, state agricultural enterprises, farms, forestry enterprises and other organizations. Protection zone of Central Forest state natural biosphere reserve is formed in order to protect the reserve's lands from adverse anthropogenic impacts on adjacent land plots and water areas. Protection zone is area with regulated and supervised regime of restricted economic activity aimed at rational management of natural resources for the purpose of sustainable socio-economic development of the territory through promotion of different types of entrepreneurial activities, promotion and support of the renewal of arts and crafts. Protection zone shall perform the following tasks: (a) protection and improvements of habitats of protected wild fauna and wild flora species; (b) protection of the populations of wild fauna and wild flora species; (c) resettlement and re-acclimatization of valuable and rare species of plants and animals in adjacent territories or in their former habitats; (d) elaboration and testing of registration and regulation of the number of game; (e) application of biotechnical arrangements; (f) protection of berry fields and feeding plants for wild animals and birds; (g) ecological monitoring; (h) long-term scientific experimental research; and (i) ecological tourism and environmental education. The following activities shall be prohibited in the protection zone: (a) application of chemicals; (b) drainage of raised bogs and peat extraction; (с) application of minerals and storage thereof in the open air; (d) procurement of soft resin of coniferous species; (e) exploration; (f) harvesting of rare and endangered wild flora species; (g) unauthorized fishing and hunting of all types; (h) harvesting of wild growing berries and mushrooms by non-residents; and (i) forest management activities shall be authorized by the regional administration.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Commission Regulation (EC) No. 2316/1999 laying down detailed rules for the application of Council Regulation (EC) 1251/1999 establishing a support system for producers of certain arable crops.
Policy_Content: Area payments shall be granted in accordance with the conditions laid down in this Regulation. In a given marketing year, no more than one application for an area payment may be made in respect of any cultivated parcel. Area payments for arable crops shall be paid solely on areas: (a) located in regions declared by the Member State as climatically and agriculturally suitable for growing arable crops; (b) fully sown in accordance with local standards; (c) on which the crop is maintained until at least the beginning of flowering under conditions of normal growth; (d) covered by applications in respect of at least 0,3 ha, each parcel cultivated being larger than the minimum size fixed by the Member State for the region concerned.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Hydrocarbons Mining Regulation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation shall be applicable to exploration, mining of hydrocarbons and development of oil fields on the territory under the jurisdiction of Turkmenistan, including seas and inland waterbodies. It shall be applicable to licensed operators carrying out mining and development of oil fields. Mining and oil extraction shall be carried out shall be carried out with the consideration of subsoil protection with a view of protection, conservation and development of hydrocarbon resources. Application for the issuance of licence for exploration, mining and development activity must contain the following information: (a) exploration method and project description; (b) map; (c) full name and permanent address of the contractor; (d) full name and address of the local representative (agent) of the contractor; (e) approximate drilling depth; and (f) description of the modalities of plugging-back of wells. All the aforesaid activities shall be carried out in accordance with contracts, plans and Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA). All mining sites and installations must be equipped with early warning and monitoring system.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 195 of the Ministry of Natural Resources instituting local branches of the Ministry.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decree is to set up the structure of local branches of the Ministry of Natural Resources of the Russian Federation and to define their sphere of competence at the local level. The Minister emphasises that some local branches of the Ministry are entitled to administer and manage public land and public water at the regional level while these tasks pertain to the sphere of competence of the  regional authorities. This Decree reforms the actual structure by validating 87 existing committees at the regional level and by setting up 13 newly-created committees. These Committees are subdivided into 3 categories: Regional Geological Centres that are entitled to administer public land, soil and subsoil for the purpose of extraction and conservation of minerals, Water Management Boards that are entitled to administer specific river basins and Committees of Natural Resources that are entitled to administer natural resources, precious stones and minerals included, at the regional level.

Policy: Land Administration Law implementing Regulations.
Policy_Content: These Regulations are formulated in order to execute the national primary policy of the rational utilization of land and protecting the farmland, carry out the restriction of land use, to control the total amount of land use for construction. Conversion of land from agriculture use to construction use is strictly controlled. The province shall implement a registration system in accordance with the Law. The local government shall compile the comprehensive land use plans. The individuals or units that exploit the state owned uncultivated mountain, field or pond should be entitled to the benefit (art. 15). The obligatory documents must be prepared to apply for the conversion of agricultural land (art. 18). The local government shall carry out inspections and reclaim land for agricultural purpose. The legal responsibilities are provided in chapter seven.

Policy_Content: This Regulation provides for amalgamation of the Ethiopian Grain Trade Enterprise with the Ethiopian Oil Seeds and Pulses Export Corporation and re-established as a public enterprise under the name of the Ethiopian Grain Trade Enterprise. The purposes for which the Enterprise is established are: a) to purchase grain from farmers and sell in local and mainly in export markets; b) to contribute towards the stabilization of markets for farmers' produces so that they will be encouraged to increase their outputs. Policy: Council Decision 1999/800/EC on concluding the Protocol concerning specially protected areas and biological diversity in the Mediterranean, and on accepting the annexes to that Protocol (Barcelona Convention).
Policy_Content: The European Union is a Contracting Party to the Convention for the Protection of the  Mediterranean Sea against Pollution (Barcelona Convention), and has also concluded four of the Protocols adopted within its framework: (1) Protocol for the prevention of pollution by dumping from ships and aircraft; (2) Protocol concerning cooperation in combating pollution by oil and other harmful substances; (3) Protocol for protection against pollution from land-based sources; (4) Protocol concerning specially protected areas. By virtue of the present Decision, the Protocol concerning specially protected areas and biological diversity in the Mediterranean and the annexes thereto are approved as well. The European Union’s acceptance was accompanied by the following statement: ‘”The Community will help implement the provisions laid down in the annexes by setting up the Natura 2000 network”.

Policy: National Environment (Waste Management) Regulations, 1999 (S.I. No 52 of 1999).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under sections 53(2) and 107 of the National Environment Act, apply: (a) to all categories of hazardous and non-hazardous waste;  (b) to the storage and disposal of hazardous waste and their movement into and out of  Uganda; and  (c) to all waste disposal facilities, land fills, sanitary fills and incinerators. The Regulations provide rules for the handling and disposal of such waste and provide the National Environment Management Authority  with the necessary powers for the control   of waste management in Uganda and any movement of (hazardous) waste into, from or through Uganda, from to or through any area under the jurisdiction of any other state. A person intending to export waste from Uganda or to import waste into Uganda shall complete a movement document in Form VII set out in the First Schedule. The Regulations also provide with respect to, among other things: cleaner production methods; a licence for transportation of or storage of waste; powers of environmental inspector; packaging and labelling of waste; operation of a waste treatment plant or disposal site; environmental impact assessment; and notification procedures and prior informed consent.

Policy: Regional Law No. 48-RZ “On protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal, economic and social grounds for ensuring protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters. The main targets of this Regional Law shall be as follows: (a) prevention of the outbreak and propagation of disasters; (b) reduction of damages and losses caused by disasters; and (c) liquidation of disasters. Policy: Decree No. 1586 of the Council of Ministers validating the Regulation on Vydritsa biosphere reserve.
Policy_Content: Vydritsa biosphere reserve shall be allotted the area of 17560 hectares and shall have as its purpose the conservation of the unique landscape with the population of rare and endangered plants and game recorded in the Red Book of Belarus. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of Vydritsa biosphere reserve: 1) land reclamation; 2) extraction of peat and sapropel; 3) clear final cutting with cutting area more than one hundred metres wide; 4) damage and annihilation of shrubbery and forest plantations and disturbance of soil; 5) water abstraction for irrigation, discharge of sewage and waste disposal in water bodies; 6) clearing of riverside natural growth except for recreational areas; 7) setting up tourist camps; 8) the use of motor boats except for life-saving and nature-conservative inspection; 9) grazing during the mating period of bids and game (till 30 June); 10) grazing in the riverside areas of the rivers Berezina, Vydritsa and Ola. The proclamation of Vydritsa biosphere reserve shall not entail the expropriation of land. The regional executive bodies shall be the managing authority of Vydritsa biosphere reserve. Land tenants must observe the regime of protected area and use ecofriendly processes. The damages caused to Vydritsa biosphere reserve shall be compensated by the legal and natural persons in conformity with the modalities established by law.

Policy: Décret nº 99-594 fixant les modalités d'application au domaine foncier rural coutumier de la loi nº 98-750.
Policy_Content: Toute personne, tout groupement informel d'ayants droit, se disant détenteur de droits sur le Domaine Foncier Rural coutumier, doit faire constater ces droits dans les délais prescrits par la loi n° 98-750. Le constat est effectué au terme d'une enquête officielle réalisée aux frais du demandeur selon les modalités déterminées par les dispositions du présent décret. Dès réception du dossier de l'enquête officielle, le Directeur départemental de l'agriculture et des ressources animales contrôle ce dossier et prépare le certificat foncier qu'il soumet à la signature du Préfet de Département. Le détenteur légal d'un certificat foncier dispose d'un délai de trois ans pour requérir l'immatriculation du bien foncier concerné.

Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 17 Chapters, regulates  Law No. 771 on State Policy on Forestry sector within the State of Tocantins. Policy: Environmental Impact Assessment (Fish Farming in Marine Waters) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999 (S.R. No. 415 of 1999).
Policy_Content: The Regulations apply to applications as regards fish farming in marine waters where any part of the proposed development is in a sensitive area, or the proposed development is designed to hold a biomass of 100 tonnes or greater, or will extend to 0.1 hectare or more of the surface area. The Regulations provide for decisions on whether consideration of environmental information in respect of such applications for fish farming in marine waters is required to be taken by the Department of Agriculture. Regulation 3 provides that the Department shall not grant a fish culture licence under section 11 of the Fisheries Act (Northern Ireland) 1966 as regards fish farming in marine waters where the project is likely to have significant effects on the environment, without taking into consideration environmental information in respect of the proposed project. Regulation 8 provides that the environmental statement shall be publicised through press advertisement and made available for public inspection, with the opportunity for representations to be made. Regulation 9 provides that the Department shall consult the bodies mentioned in Schedule 3 about the environmental statement. Regulation 12 provides that the Water Appeals Commission for Northern Ireland shall not dispose of any appeal in relation to an application for a fish culture licence as regards fish farming in marine waters where the proposed development will be likely to have significant effects on the environment unless it has taken into consideration environmental information in respect of the proposed development. Regulation 14 implements Article 7 of the Directive by providing for consultation between Members States in cases of development likely to have significant effects in another Member State. Schedule 1 describes the selection criteria in relation to screening opinions of the Department. Schedule 2 sets out the information that is required in an environmental statement. Schedule 3 lists the bodies to be consulted by the Department under the Regulations.
Subject: Fisheries, Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: National Forest Programme of Cyprus and National Forest Policy Statement.
Policy_Content: This document is a national sectoral policy covering the period 2000-2009. The objective of this Policy is to increase the forest sector development, to protect and enhance the natural environment and to promote recreation and tourism with a rural development approach. To achieve these objectives the Policy defines measures for: a) extending the forest area by afforestation and increasing silviculture; b) increasing the production of timber and non-wood products; c) increasing effectiveness of protection against fires and other hazards; d) ensuring the conservation of ecosystems, flora, fauna and heritage; e) increasing the quantity of water coming from forests and enhancing water supply; f) encouraging appropriate development, based on ecotourism, within local plans and village development; g) ensuring institutional reform, modernization and capacity building.

Policy: National Policy on Disaster Management 1999.
Policy_Content: The Principles of the Disaster Management Policy specify that the community in the affected area must have a significant role in planning and implementing disaster management activities. The various preventive measures to disaster situations must be assessed and implemented according to the criteria of the population and property at greatest risk, and the negative effect on the economy. In all instances, free emergency assistance will be distributed to the most vulnerable populations and under no circumstances will it be provided to people with a normal state of health and nutrition and with purchasing power. In the event of an emergency the focal or reference points for all actions at all levels will be clearly defined, and the State co-ordination bodies will be provided with adequate powers. The strategy of avoiding the creation of parallel structures will always be followed, thereby ensuring a close connection between emergency activities and multi-sectoral institution building, with a view to maximising scarce resources. The Government will promote the active participation of civil society in all phases of disaster management.

Policy: Regional Law No. 150 “On seed-growing”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates the issues of seed production, procurement, processing, storage, transportation, trade and utilization of seeds of agricultural crops. It shall be applicable to seeds inserted in the State Register of Selection Achievements and authorized for use, and non-inserted in the aforesaid register that can be used for scientific research and individual non-commercial purposes. Agricultural seeds shall be classified as follows: (a) original; (b) elite; and (c) reproduction. Forest seeds shall be classified as follows: (a) normal; (b) improved; and (c) variety. Only seeds complying with state standards and variety requirements shall be authorized for seed production. State support to seed growing of agricultural crops shall be granted in the form of preferential tax application, compensation of part of expenditure for seed growing and subsidies.

Policy: Instruction on the implementation of state control for compliance with the maximum permissible rates of toxic vehicle emissions for vehicles in operation and charging and collection of environmental fees for air pollution.
Policy_Content: This Instruction establishes that for individual vehicles, checks shall be performed at state control points with measuring instruments. In case of exceeding the maximum permissible rates of emissions, a protocol is drawn up for bringing to administrative responsibility in the manner established by the legislation of the Republic of Tajikistan and a decision is issued to ban the operation of this vehicle before adjusting the fuel system. An order is issued to correct deficiencies within 3 days. In case of non-elimination of deficiencies, the resolution on the prohibition of operation is sent to the traffic police bodies at the place of registration of vehicle. Automobile operating companies and organizations after checking the motor vehicle exhaust gases for toxic emissions, following the established standards and submitting a payment order confirming the bank's payment of environmental charges for atmospheric air pollution within the established standards, for each vehicle shall be issued a certificate “On the state of motor vehicle emissions.” In case of detection of exceeding the established norms, a protocol is drawn up. Based on the protocol to chief engineer or mechanic (the person responsible for the release on the line of vehicles) shall be issued an order to ban the operation of vehicles until adjusting the fuel system within 3 days. In case of non-elimination of deficiencies, the resolution on the prohibition of operation is sent to the traffic police bodies at the place of registration of vehicles.

Policy: Merchant Shipping Code (No. 599-XIV).
Policy_Content: Mercantile Marine Navigation Code shall be applicable to: (a) fishing vessels; (b) marine subsoil exploration vessels; (c) sanitary, quarantine and other vessels; (d) marine environment protection vessels; and (e) marine research vessels. The state supervision over mercantile marine navigation shall be carried out for the purpose of protection and conservation of marine environment and certification of equipment on board. Fishing gear shall be integral part of board equipment of the fishing vessels. Fishing vessels must be in possession of international safety certificate except for fishing vessels used for fish processing and transportation of fish and other aquatic biodiversity, scientific research and training fishing vessels. Shipowner shall be liable for oil pollution from ship.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1249 on purposeful land use.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the purposeful land use, the modalities of the modification thereof and the decision-making in this regard. The main purposeful land use shall be established in accordance with the territorial land use planning documentation and the local self-government shall make the decision on validation or modification of the main purposeful land use. It classifies land in accordance with the purposeful use thereof as agricultural land and forest estate land. The main purposeful land use can be changed if landowner, manager or lessee of public land submits application for the modification of the main purposeful use of agricultural or forest estate land. In case of the modification of the purposeful land use a plot of land must be separated from the rest land area. Application must contain: (a) a copy of land registration certificate; (b) map of the plot of land; and (c) copy of land use planning document.

Policy: Offshore Petroleum and Greenhouse Gas Storage (Environment) Regulations 2009.
Policy_Content: These Regulations aim at ensuring that offshore petroleum exploration and development operations are performed in a way that is consistent with the principles of ecologically sustainable development, reducing environmental risks and effects to as low as reasonably practicable and is acceptable. Any petroleum activity or greenhouse gas storage activity in the offshore area shall be carried out in accordance with an environmental plan that has: (a) appropriate environmental performance objectives and standards; and (b) measurement criteria for determining whether the objectives and standards have been met. Plans shall be prepared by operators and approved by the Regulator in accordance with these Regulations. Other provisions of these Regulations concern, among other things, discharges of produced formation water and reporting on incidents.

Policy: Petroleum (Submerged Lands) (Management of Environment) Regulations 1999.
Policy_Content: The object of these Regulations is to ensure that any petroleum activity in an adjacent area is carried out in a way that is consistent with the principles of ecologically sustainable development, in accordance with an environment plan that has appropriate environmental performance objectives and standards as well as measurement criteria for determining whether the objectives and standards are met. An operator, of a petroleum activity i.e. the person recorded by the Designated Authority under regulation 35 as the operator of a petroleum activity (defined in regulation 4), or if there is no such person, the person responsible to the petroleum instrument holder for the overall management of operations for the activity shall adopt an environment plan for the activity. Operations must comply with the environment plan submitted by the operator and accepted by the Designated Authority under provisions of Part 2. The operator of an activity must ensure that the concentration of petroleum in any produced formation water discharged into the sea as a result of operations for the activity shall not be greater than prescribed in regulation 29. Policy: Implementation Measures of the Shanxi Province on the "Land Administration Law of the People's Republic of China".
Policy_Content: These measures propose to strengthen land administration, the protection of land rights, and to improve utilization of land in Shanxi. Chapter I provides for administration of land. The local government shall restrict conversion of land for agriculture to land for construction. Chapter 2 concerns ownership of land and land use rights. The Province shall implement a land registration system in accordance with the Law. Chapter 3 makes provision for comprehensive land utilization plans to be drawn up by local governments. Chapter 4 contains provisions for the protection of farmland. It shall be prohibited to leave arable land lie idle or waste. Local governments shall carry out inspections and reclaim land for agricultural purposes. Chapter 5 concerns land used for construction; Chapter 6 provides for supervision and inspection; Chapter 7 defines legal responsibility for breach of law by citizens and local governments.

Policy: Forests Act (No. 3 of 1999).
Policy_Content: The declared (sect. 3) objects of the Act are: ensuring effective and ecologically sustainable management of forest resources; promotion of a sustainable commercial timber industry, and; protection and conservation of forest resources, habitats and ecosystems including the maintenance of ecological processes and genetic diversity. The administration of matters affecting forests is entrusted to Commissioner of Forests appointed under section 6 and the Minister who shall be advised by the Solomon Forestry Board established under section 5. The Commissioner shall prepare and supervise the carrying into effect of the national timber industry policy and a national forest resource management strategy (sect. 7). The contents of the policy are outlined in section 12, the contents of the strategy in section 14. A code of practice for timber harvesting and forest management shall be adopted by the Minister in accordance with section 16. The Commissioner may, in accordance with section 20, determine the potential forest uses for an area of forest. Part IV of the Act makes provision for the control of forestry activities such as timber harvesting, contractor arrangements, land clearing, timber processing, timber marketing and exportation of timber. Part V provides in detail for matters regarding "forest access" (defined in section 2), such as the recognition of customary forest access rights and the negotiation of forest access rights. It restricts the transfer, etc. of forest access rights in relation to unregistered customary land in the sense of the Land and Titles Act (cap. 133). A Statement of customary ownership may be lodged by owners of unregistered land under sections 71 to 76. Section deals with disputes in relation to such statements. The Commissioner shall invite customary owners to determine the potential forest uses on their land (sect. 79 and following). The form of a forest agreement, which requires consent by provincial authorities, is outlined in section 83. Part VI make provision with respect to State forests. The Minister may declare land in which the Commissioner holds a freehold or leasehold interest, to be a State forest. The Minister may, for purposes of water conservation, declare any rainfall catchment area to be a forest reserve under section 91 (Part VII: Forest Reserves). Part VIII grants power of enforcement to the Commissioner and to forest inspectors who shall be appointed by the Minister under section 96, whereas Part IX ("Miscellaneous Provisions") grants regulation making powers to the Minister and protects officials against proceedings for acts done in good faith. (122 sections completed by one Schedule)

Policy: Law No. 591-XIV on urban green belts.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations in the sphere of development and protection of green belts of urban and inhabited areas for the purpose of creating healthy and aesthetically favourable environment. Green belts shall be considered parks, urban forests, gardens and forest belts along the roadside for protection and recreational purposes. The Act consists of 13 Sections divided into 41 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) competence of public authority; (3) rights of natural persons, duties of natural and legal persons; (4) classification of green belts; (5) management and economic activities in green belt areas; (6) creation, reproduction and care for green belts; (7) protection and conservation of green belts; (8) organization, registration and monitoring of green belts; (9) ensuring wholeness of green belts; (10) liability and dispute settlement; (11) financing; (12) international cooperation; and (13) conclusive provisions. Green belts shall carry out the following functions: (a) reduction of the concentration of pollutants in the atmosphere; (b) noise reduction; (c) conservation of water resources, protection against soil erosion and landslide; (d) harmonization of artificial and natural landscapes; (e) improvement of land use planning; and (f) recreation. Green belt areas shall include: (a) urban land; (b) rural inhabited areas; (c) recreational areas; (d) roadside; (e) forest nurseries and forest plantations; and (f) abandoned land – bogs, cliffs, promontories, cleaving stones and landslide.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 605 validating the Regulation on state nature reserve of regional significance “Chikmansky”.
Policy_Content: State nature reserve of regional significance “Chikmansky” shall be considered biological (zoological) reserve constituted with a view of conservation and reproduction of precious, rare and endangered wild fauna species and natural habitats thereof. Protected natural area of regional significance shall be organized for an unlimited period of time for the following purposes: (a) conservation of natural complexes and objects of forest steppe areas of Western Siberia in a natural state; (b) conservation, reproduction and restoration of natural resources, enrichment of adjoining land areas used for economic activities; (c) protection, conservation and reproduction of mating and reproduction grounds of elk, roe deer, hares, black grouse species, colonies of badgers and other wild fauna species; (d) protection of habitats of rare and endangered species; and (e) ensuring environmental education of the population. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) commercial, sport, artisanal hunting and other form of wildlife management; (b) all types of fisheries; (c) all types of felling except for sanitary felling; (d) destruction of forest outliers by any economic activity; (e) harvesting and procurement of non-timber forest products, except for procurement and collection of twigs for fodder and harvesting of spruce and other coniferous tree species for New Year holidays); (f) procurement of edible non-timber products and medicinal plants except for procurement thereof by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) cultivation of forest fruit bearing, ornamental and medicinal plant species; (i) use of forests for wood processing; (j) application and storage of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and nutrients; (k) haymaking, grazing and passage of cattle outside specially allotted areas; (l) destruction or removal form natural environment of endangered plant species and mushrooms; (m) ploughing up of the territory; (n) destruction of nidifugous burrows, except for harmful animals; (o) devastation of nests and collection of eggs (except for crows); (p) drainage and irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (q) burning of vegetation; (r) blasting operations; (s) water logging, construction of water reservoirs and other artificial waterbodies, and construction of waterworks; (t) allotment of land plots for construction, collective gardening and horticulture; (u) release and acclimatization of alien species; (u) zoological, botanical, mineralogical and paleontological collections; (v) recreational activities; (w) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs; (x) movement of motor vehicles outside roads of common access; (y) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons; and (z) stay with unleashed dogs outside residential areas, sharpening and training of hunting dogs.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1056 of 1999 regarding the validation of the Statute of the Federal Committee on Land Policy.
Policy_Content: This Decree validates the Statute of the Federal Committee on Land Policy. Federal Committee on Land Policy (GOSKOMZEM) is the Federal Authority that coordinates interministerial activity of the issues pertaining to the sphere of land relationship, functional regulation in this field, including the keeping up of land cadastre, valuation of land, land survey , state control over the use of land and the soil protection. Federal Committee on Land Policy has its local (territorial) branches at the regional level. It supervises the functioning of the state unitary enterprises and agencies on land resources and land survey, land monitoring and aero-photo-geodetic research service. This Decree establishes that the functioning of this Committee is regulated by the Russian Constitution, by Federal Laws, Presidential and Governmental Decrees and Orders and by this Statute. The President of the Federal Committee on Land Policy is appointed and dismissed by the Government. The President of the Committee is considered the Chief Federal (State) Inspector on land use and soil protection. This Decree contains the full text of the Statute.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 513 validating the Regulation on purchase, sale, storage, registration and transportation of virulent poisonous substances.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree shall be applicable to virulent poisonous substances used in agriculture and veterinary. Many of the aforesaid hazardous substances can have negative environmental impact. Authorization for management of virulent poisonous substances shall be issued by the Ministry of Public Health and all the activities related thereto shall be posted under the supervision of the Ministry of Interior except for virulent poisonous substances used in veterinary for which no authorization shall be required. Import of virulent poisonous substances shall be licensed. Application for storage of virulent poisonous substances shall contain the following documentation: (a) quantity of substances; (b) availability of storage facilities; (c) list of personnel having access to substances and availability of security services; and (d) copy of the order of the head of the organization appointing the person in charge of storage. Storage facilities shall be specifically equipped for storing hazardous substances. Storage of hazardous substances in the open air shall be prohibited. Authorization of the Ministry of Interior shall not be required for the transportation of virulent poisonous substances by rail.

Policy_Content: El Consejo de Ministros de Integración Económica (COMIECO) de Centroamérica, mediante Resolución Nº 37-99 (COMIECO-XIII) aprobó el Reglamento Centroamericano de medidas de normalización, metrología y procedimientos de autorización (Anexo 1) y el Reglamento Centroamericano sobre medidas y procedimientos sanitarios y fitosanitarios (Anexo 2). Policy: Mines and Minerals Rules, 2056 (1999).
Policy_Content: In exercise of the power conferred by Section 28 of Mines and Minerals Act, 2042 (1985), Government of Nepal has framed the Mines and Minerals Rules, 1999 (2056). These Rules, consisting of 56 sections divided into nine Chapters and completed by 14 Schedules, regulate all aspects related to minerals. The minerals as specified in Schedule 1 shall be included within the classed of minerals referred to in Sub-section (1) of Section 3A of the Act. For the purpose of this Rules, the mining operation of metallic and non-metallic minerals shall, on the basis of daily production, be divided into following scales: (a) Very small Scale; (b) Small Scale; (c) Medium Scale; and (d) Large Scale. The scales of the mining operation of minerals as referred to in Sub-rule (1) shall be as prescribed in Schedule-2. In addition, the Rules specify the requirements to be met for obtaining an authorization to carry out mining operations of precious or valuable minerals. These Rules are divided as follows: Classes and Scales of Minerals and Qualifications of a Person Desirous to carry out Mining Operations (Chap. 2); Provisions Concerning Prospecting Operations (Chap. 3); Provisions Concerning Excavation (Chap. 4); Provisions Relating to Specified Minerals (Chap. 5); Mineral Deposits and Environment Protection (Chap. 6); Special Provisions for Ordinary Construction Oriented Minerals (Chap. 7); Provision Concerning Establishment and Functions, Duties and Powers of the Centre (Chap. 8); and Miscellaneous (Chap. 9).
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Southern Asia

Policy: Law on leasing (1999).

Policy: Regional Law No. 8-463 “On energy saving”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates legal, economic and organizational relations originating in the process of production, transportation and consumption of fuel and energy with a view of raising of efficiency of the use of fuel and energy resources. Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 302-pg “On organization of natural park “Veps forest”.
Policy_Content: This Governor’s Decree establishes that regional state institution “National park “Veps forest” shall be classified as nature protection, ecological educational, scientific research and recreational institution, performing also economic activities, containing nature complexes, ecosystems and objects of particular ecological, historic and aesthetic value. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) ecosystem conservation; (b) conservation and restoration of disturbed ecosystems, including different types of wetlands; (c) restoration of disturbed natural, historical and cultural complexes and objects; (d) conservation of vast forested areas for improvement of atmospheric air; (e) formation of tourist routes and ecological education; and (f) forest management and forestry protection measures. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) any activity that could damage natural complexes, nature monuments and cultural heritage; (a) construction; (b) clear felling; (c) industrial activity representing environmental risks.

Policy: Law No. 158/99 on the Forestry inter-professionalism basis.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 14 articles, establishes the Forestry inter-professionalism basis. The inter-professional organizations of the forestry sector, (OIF), are representative structures of the production, processing, services and commercialization of forestry products. The OIF shall be granted the status of legal person governed by private law and public utility. For each product or group of products, only one inter-professional organization of the national level may be recognized. The objectives of OIF are: contribute to better knowledge and transparency of markets; promote research and development programmes in liaison with public research entities with a view to obtaining a better adaptation to market needs; contribute to and encourage the implementation of training schemes for the professional qualification for work in the forestry sector; develop actions to promote forest products and their associated spaces in the domestic and foreign markets; contribute to quality control in production, service provision, processing and packaging of the final product; encourage the implementation of health and quality control; promote and encourage actions aimed at contributing to the sustainable development of the forest and to safeguarding the associated natural systems; encourage the re-use of forest products for energy purposes, with a view to optimizing the management of energy sources and protecting the environment; develop measures to promote an appropriate balance of supply and demand for the products concerned; contribute to the certification of forest products and the management of the related spaces. The OIF Register is created in the Ministry of Agriculture, Rural Development and Fisheries.
